description:
When your day begins with being held hostage in a hijacking, can things get much worse? How about being kicked out of your own body? Or learning that if you can't re-possess your physical shell, you'll trigger a panty-fueled apocalypse that will wipe out all life on the planet? For Yuta Iridatsu, it's just the start of the worst out-of-body experience ever. Now, if his dissed disembodied spirit doesn't pursue the persuasions of a porn-obsessed paranormal pussycat and purloin a missing mystical manual, a meteor will collide with Earth! And to stack the odds even further, the book is hidden somewhere in the boarding house Yuta shares with a bevy of beautiful babes, but if he gets an eyeful of his ravishing co-renters in their unmentionables before he's back in himself, it's flash-forward to Doomsday! Will the literal end of the world be wearing briefs, a bikini, or a thong? Find out when panties, possessions and extinction level events have the ultimate rear-end collision in PUNCH LINE!

(Source: Sentai Filmworks)

tags.name: Afterlife
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the afterlife.

tags.name: Superhero
tags.description: Prominently features super-powered humans who aim to serve the greater good.

tags.name: Ghost
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a ghost.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Gender Bending
tags.description: Prominently features a character who dresses and behaves in a way characteristic of another gender, or has been transformed into a person of another gender.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Time Loop
tags.description: A character is stuck in a repetitive cycle that they are attempting to break out of. This is distinct from a manipulating time of their own choice.

tags.name: Body Swapping
tags.description: Centers around individuals swapping bodies with one another.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Transgender
tags.description: Features a character whose gender identity differs from the sex they were assigned at birth.

tags.name: Robots
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid machines.

tags.name: Bisexual
tags.description: Features a character who is romantically or sexually attracted to people of more than one sex or gender.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Video Games
tags.description: Centers around characters playing video games.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

alternative: Strange Juice (ストレンジジュース)

node.description: Tetsuya Komuro, also known as TK, is a Japanese keyboardist, guitarist, singer, songwriter and music producer.     He is recognized as being the most successful producer in Japanese music history and introduced dance music to the Japanese mainstream. He was also a former owner of the discothèque Velfarre located in Roppongi, Tokyo.    He is widely regarded as one of the most influential figures in pop throughout the 1990s.    In the Oricon singles chart of April 15, 1996, he monopolized all the Top 5 positions as the songwriter and producer, a world record. In 1995 he monopolized all Top 3 positions of the copyright distribution rankings for the JASRAC Award, a record in Japan's music history.    At his peak as a record producer the artists he predominantly produced for came to be known as TK Family and at one time included Namie Amuro, hitomi, TRF, Tomomi Kahala and Ami Suzuki amongst others.    To date, singles composed by him have sold more than 70 million, singles whose lyrics he wrote have sold more than 42 million, and all in all records produced by him have sold more than 170 million in Japan alone.

Kotaro Uchikoshi is a Japanese video game director and writer. He is known for his work on visual novel games, including the Infinity and Zero Escape series. His writing style often incorporates elements of science fiction with various scientific and philosophical themes, and makes heavy use of plot twists.

Interested in narrative based games from a young age, Uchikoshi studied video game development at a vocational school. His first job in game development was at KID in 1998, where he primarily wrote scenarios for bishoujo games and other visual novels. These included Memories Off (1999) and Never 7: The End of Infinity (2000). In 2001, he left KID to become a freelance writer, and continued to work on visual novels. Uchikoshi joined Chunsoft in 2007, where he came up with the idea of integrating puzzles into a visual novel for the player to solve. He implemented this idea in Nine Hours, Nine Persons, Nine Doors (2009), the first game in which he served as the director.

[Website](https://dempagumi.tokyo/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/dempagumi) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/dempagumi.official/) | [Facebook](https://ja-jp.facebook.com/dempagumi.inc/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/dempagumiinc) | [LINE LIVE](https://live.line.me/channels/265) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dempagumi.inc) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/でんぱ組.inc)

Dempagumi.inc is a Japanese idol group. They belong to “DEARSTAGE” and are active in various fields. All the members are originally hard core geeks / otaku of anime, manga, games, fashion, art, etc. and they each pursue their own hobbies! They belong to a new record label, MEME TOKYO, produced by TOY’S FACTORY. They introduced new members Rin Kaname and Nagi Nemoto, on December 30th 2017.

__Members:__
• Mirin-chan - __Mirin Furukawa__ (古川未鈴) born September 19th in Kagawa prefecture, Japan. - [Twitter](https://twitter.com/FurukawaMirin) | [Instagram](https://instagram.com/furukawamirin) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCO7Hr02PJtVjzVTl1X-MmEA) | [Twitch](https://www.twitch.tv/furukawamirin)
• Risachii - __Risa Aizawa__ (相沢梨紗) born August 2nd in Osaka Prefecture, Japan. - [Twitter](https://twitter.com/RISA_memesama) | [Instagram](https://instagram.com/risacheeese) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC7uGtrz1dYludhU1VCkQGRg)
• Eitaso - __Eimi Naruse__ (成瀬瑛美) born February 16th in Fukushima prefecture, Japan. - [Twitter](https://twitter.com/eitaso) | [Instagram](https://instagram.com/eimisunshine) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCUZD1m9TozXJR0YLI3trPhw)
• Pinky! - __Ayane Fujisaki__ (藤咲彩音) born December 7th in Saitama prefecture, Japan. - [Twitter](https://twitter.com/PINKY_neko) | [Instagram](https://instagram.com/pinky_ayane) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCGWWUlpP5u4WBvUf5wmbxKw)
• Perorin - __Rin Kaname__ (鹿目凛) born September 21st in Saitama prefecture, Japan. - [Twitter](https://twitter.com/peroperorinko01) | [Instagram](https://instagram.com/kaname_rin) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC7S0hgqh_7uZadf_shmOruQ)
• Nemo - __Nagi Nemoto__ (根本凪) born March 15th in Ibaraki Prefecture, Japan. - [Twitter](https://twitter.com/nemoto_nagi) | [Instagram](https://instagram.com/nemonagi) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCxDX9DXSqoRxxB-NO5Hz6XQ)

__Former Members:__
• Akari Owata (小和田あかり)
• Miu Atobe (跡部みぅ)
• [Moga Mogami](https://anilist.co/staff/155223) (最上もが)
• Nemu Yumemi (夢眠ねむ)

__Height:__ 160 cm

[Website](http://www.amamiyasora.jp/) | [Profile](http://musicrayn.com/amamiya_sora) | [Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/amamiyasorablog/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCc4xpujLxnUBSI1XX-SdldQ) | [Second YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC2oaLFNojVzLwQaA5KJOy3g) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Amamiyastaff) 

While a sophomore in high school, Amamiya was introduced to a video collection of roles of voice actress [Miyuki Sawashiro](https://anilist.co/staff/95099). Following this, Amamiya decided to become a voice actress.

Amamiya, together with [Momo Asakura](https://anilist.co/staff/118479) and [Shiina Natsukawa](https://anilist.co/staff/118818), passed an audition held by Music Ray'n in 2011, with the three making their voice acting debut in 2012. She made her official music debut for Music Ray'n by performing Akame ga Kill's opening theme "Skyreach." In late 2014, Amamiya, Asakura, and Natsukawa formed the music unit [TrySail](https://anilist.co/staff/144938/), which released its first single "Youthful Dreamer," used as the opening theme to the anime television series Ultimate Otaku Teacher, on May 13, 2015.

Amamiya, together with [Reina Ueda](https://anilist.co/staff/118602) and [Aya Suzaki](https://anilist.co/staff/114834), received the Best New Actress award at the 9th Seiyu Awards in March 2015.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/chiyomaru5pb)__ | __[Company Profile (MAGES)](http://mages.co.jp/about/company/)__

__Chiyomaru Shikura__ is a Japanese guitarist, novelist, voice actor, radio personality, moderator, animation planner, animation supervisor, music producer, composer, arranger and the representative director of 5pb./MAGES. 

Chiyomaru resigns as chairman and representative director of MAGES. on January 4th, 2023.

He has been the producer and lead animation planner for titles such as Chaos;Head, Steins;Gate, and Robotics;Notes. Shikura is also a very active composer and lyricist. To date, he has written over a hundred theme songs for the video games and anime adaptations he's worked on.
Youko Matsuzaki is a producer at Fuji TV.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Kimu777)

Makoto Kimura is an animation producer originally from Fuji TV Noitamina. He then moved to [Twin Engine](https://anilist.co/studio/6199/Twin-Engine) and later then to Studio [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/MAPPA) where he was the Director of Planning Department. In April 2024, he left MAPPA and formed BLUE RIGHTS Co. Ltd.

_Note: Not to be confused with the background artist [Makoto Kimura](https://anilist.co/staff/182523/)._
Director and General Manager of CGI Department at [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/). He's also a Board Member at [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/).
